newsitem.title: SWEDEN: Swedish shares close weaker depressed by Astra.
newsitem.headline: Swedish shares close weaker depressed by Astra.

text.p: The Stockholm bourse closed weaker on Monday ahead of a three-day break, pushed off an intraday record high when drugs major Astra fell in afternoon trade.
The Stockholm general index slipped 0.07 percent to 2,325.95, falling back after reaching a new high in morning trade that had added to the bourse's record close on Friday.

Shares worth 4.84 billion crowns changed hands during the day but trade worth 2.96 billion crowns was due to Norway's Statkraft changing C-series shares to A-series shares in Swedish power group Sydkraft.
Drugs major Astra closed 5.5 crowns lower at 322.5 crowns, pulling the drugs sector index down 0.95 percent.
"Trade was very light. The only thing that happened ws that Astra fell a little at the end," said one broker.
Fellow bluechip, telecoms giant LM Ericsson AB rose 1.5 to 207 crowns.
The best performing sector was the investment branch that rose 1.12 percent. The Wallenberg family's investment vehicle, Investor, ended the day up four crowns at 296 crowns.
